SENT.plain: Oxaliplatin (L-OHP), a platinum-containing antineoplastic agent, is a key drug for the treatment of colorectal cancer
However, it is often difficult to continue with its treatment because of the expression of allergic reactions
This study was an investigation of the expression of allergic reactions resulting from administration of L-OHP
A retrospective analysis was performed on patients undergoing therapeutic regimens including L-OHP, from April 2009 to November 2010 in Juntendo University Urayasu Hospital
The results showed that allergic reactions were expressed in 15 out of 81 patients (18

It was possible to continue treatment with L-OHP in six patients even after expression of allergic reactions
Anti-allergy measures such as additional administration of steroids or antihistamines were suggested to be useful for continuing treatment
